choices.text:
what are the verb tenses?
There are twelve verb tenses in English: 
1. Simple Present - expresses actions that happen regularly or always, or future actions with no sense of urgency or suddenness 
2. Simple Past - expresses completed actions in the past 
3. Present Perfect - expresses actions that started in the past and continue up to the present or have been completed recently 
4. Future Simple - expresses actions that will happen in the future 
5. Future Continuous - expresses ongoing actions in the future 
6. Past continuous - expresses ongoing actions in the past 
7. Present Perfect Continuous - expresses actions that have been happening for a period of time up to the present moment 
8. Simple Future perfect - expresses completed actions before a specific time in the future 
9. Future perfect - expresses actions that will be completed at some point in the future 
10. Past Perfect - expresses completed actions before a specific time in the past 
11. Present Perfect Continuous and Simple Past continuous are used to show ongoing or repeated actions in the past or present respectively, while Future perfect and Future perfect continuous are used to indicate that an action will be completed at some point in the future.
